page.title: 01ST.MAWGAN & RAF ST MAWGAN
page.content: Our block is composed of 3 features, St Mawgan village, Watergate Bay and RAF St Mawgan. As Watergate beach cuts into another block we have largely ignored this feature. St Mawgan is a lively, picturesque village nestling in the Vale of Lanherne. It is noted for its festivals- feast day, church flower festival, rotary club fair, church summer fair.It is a warm and friendly village. A settlement has existed on this sight from at least Roman times, possibly due to tin streaming. Lanherne is one of the few wooded valleys on the north coast of Cornwall. Farming,tourism and RAF provide most employment. RAF St Mawgan is a military airfield, reconnaisance Nimrods of 42 squadron are based here. On the same site is a civil airfield which has future growth potential.
